meanings.definition: A small stalk-like structure, especially one supporting or connecting parts of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The pedicles of the plant help it stand tall and gather sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the pedicles in the human body to understand their role in movement.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ants formed a chain using the pedicles of leaves to cross the stream.
meanings.sent4: The pedicles of friendship connect us, supporting each other through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The pedicles of the bridge were so delicate, yet they held the weight of many cars.

meanings.definition: A slender process of a bone that projects from the main body.
meanings.sent1: The pedicles of the vertebrae provide attachment points for muscles.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully examined the pedicles during the spinal operation.
meanings.sent3: The pedicles of the skeleton seemed like tiny branches growing from the bones.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the pedicles that extended her reach beyond her limits.
meanings.sent5: The pedicles of the tree roots spread far and wide, anchoring the tree firmly in the ground.
